page.title: 02WICHENFORD COURT
page.content: {Wichenford Court}was originally owned by the{Washbourne}family, now living in America, but retaining links with the village. In 1856{Mr. Britten of Kenswick Manor bought the Court for his son, and descendant Colonel Patrick Britten lives there today. The present Manor is a{large brick and {stone house}built in 1710 on the traditional site. The gardens are restored in Carolean style, and a beautiful{moat,}with{trout}and {waterfowl}surrounds the house. In the grounds stands a{17th century timber framed{dovecote}with{557 {nesting boxes,}now owned by the {National Trust. Many{legends}are told of the Court, including Margaret Washbourne stabbing a French prince there, and her ghost riding the moat in a swan drawn boat.
